subscription_alternative.monthly_limit: Usage caps apply (e.g., ~80 messages every 3 hours for GPT-4o), not a hard token limit.
Estimated 5x the usage limits of the free tier, subject to fair use policy.
Included in Google One AI Premium plan, no explicit token limit stated for Gemini 1.5 Pro.
Access to Gemini 1.5 Ultra (Flash/Pro models available via API, Ultra is subscription-only).

llama_3_8b_instruct.note: Pricing is for hosting on third-party platforms like AWS Bedrock or Google Vertex AI, as Meta's models are open-source.

llama_3_70b_instruct.note: Pricing is for hosting on third-party platforms like AWS Bedrock.

subscription_alternative.monthly_limit: For individuals, includes priority access to latest models and usage during peak times.
Enterprise tier, integrates Copilot across Microsoft 365 apps. Per user, per month.

qwen_turbo.note: Pricing from Alibaba Cloud Model Studio, can vary by region.

pricing_analysis.average_calculation_note: Average calculated from models with defined per-token pricing: GPT-4o, GPT-4 Turbo, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, Claude 3 Haiku, Gemini Pro, Llama 3 8B, Llama 3 70B, DeepSeek V2, Qwen Turbo.
pricing_analysis.subscription_adoption_rate_trend: High and growing; major providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google) have standardized on a ~$20/month consumer tier, suggesting strong market acceptance.
pricing_analysis.trend: An aggressive price war is driving down per-token costs dramatically, especially for input tokens. Models from Chinese companies (DeepSeek, Qwen) are setting new lows for efficiency. There's a clear bifurcation: commoditized, cheaper models for high-volume tasks and premium, top-tier models sold via both API and subscription. Subscription models are increasingly bundling AI access with other services (e.g., Google One, Microsoft 365).
